00020 #ifndef BOOST_INCLUDED_XINT_PRIME_HPP
00021 #define BOOST_INCLUDED_XINT_PRIME_HPP

00024 namespace boost {
00025 namespace xint {
00026 namespace detail {
00027 
00028 inline std::vector<int> sieveOfEratosthenes(int upTo) {
00029     std::vector<int> sieve;
00030     sieve.reserve(upTo);
00031 
00032     // Zero and one aren't prime, by definition.
00033     sieve.push_back(0);
00034     sieve.push_back(0);
00035 
00036     for (int p = 2; p < upTo; ++p) sieve.push_back(p);
00037 
00038     std::vector<int> ret;
00039 
00040     int *p = &sieve[0], *e = p + upTo;
00041     while (p < e) {
00042         if (*p == 0) { ++p; continue; }
00043         ret.push_back(*p);
00044 
00045         int *p2 = p + (*p);
00046         while (p2 < e) { *p2 = 0; p2 += *p; }
00047 
00048         ++p;
00049     }
00050 
00051     return ret;
00052 }
00053 
00054 // The Miller-Rabin Probabilistic Test of Primality
00055 BOOST_XINT_RAWINT_TPL
00056 int isProbablePrimeBaseB(const BOOST_XINT_RAWINT &n, const BOOST_XINT_RAWINT &b,
00057     callback_t callback)
00058 {
00059     const BOOST_XINT_RAWINT one(1), nMinus1(n - one);
00060 
00061     // Find r and a satisfying: n - 1 = 2^a * r, r odd
00062     BOOST_XINT_RAWINT r(nMinus1);
00063     unsigned long a = 0;
00064     while (r.is_even()) { r >>= 1; ++a; }
00065 
00066     // We check the congruence class of b^((2^i)r) % n for each i
00067     // from 0 to a - 1. If any one is correct, then n passes.
00068     // Otherwise, n fails.
00069     BOOST_XINT_RAWINT test = powmod(b, r, n);
00070     if (test == one || test == nMinus1)
00071         return 1; // Better than 3/4 chance it's prime
00072 
00073     while (a-- > 0) {
00074         test = sqrmod(test, n);
00075         if (test == nMinus1) return 1;
00076     }
00077 
00078     if (callback && !callback()) return -1;
00079     return 0;
00080 }
00081 
00082 template <bitsize_t Bits, bool Secure, class Alloc, class GenType>
00083 int is_probably_prime(const BOOST_XINT_RAWINT &n, GenType &gen, callback_t
00084     callback)
00085 {
00086     BOOST_XINT_RAWINT tmp(2);
00087     if (n < tmp) exception_handler<>::call(__FILE__, __LINE__,
00088         exceptions::invalid_argument("xint::is_probably_prime cannot test "
00089             "numbers below positive 2"));
00090 
00091     // First we trial-divide it by the primes below 2000
00092     static const std::vector<int> low_primes(sieveOfEratosthenes(2000));
00093     const BOOST_XINT_RAWINT zero;
00094     std::vector<int>::const_iterator i = low_primes.begin(), ie =
00095         low_primes.end();
00096     for (; i != ie; ++i) {
00097         tmp.set_unsigned(*i);
00098         if ((n % tmp) == zero)
00099             return (n == tmp);
00100     }
00101 
00102     // Run the number through the Miller-Rabin Probabilistic Test of Primality
00103     // a few times to see if it's actually (probably) prime.
00104     for (int count = 0; count < 5; ++count) {
00105         unsigned int k = gen();
00106         tmp.set_unsigned(k);
00107         int isP = isProbablePrimeBaseB(n, tmp, callback);
00108         if (isP <= 0) return isP;
00109     }
00110     return 1; // Appears to be prime!
00111 }
00112 
00113 BOOST_XINT_RAWINT_TPL
00114 template <typename GenType>
00115 BOOST_XINT_RAWINT BOOST_XINT_RAWINT::random_prime(GenType &gen, std::size_t
00116     size_in_bits, callback_t callback)
00117 {
00118     if (size_in_bits < 2) exception_handler<>::call(__FILE__, __LINE__,
00119         exceptions::invalid_argument("cannot create prime numbers smaller than "
00120         "two bits"));
00121 
00122     // Call the callback for the first time
00123     if (callback && !callback()) return 0;
00124 
00125     // If, by rare chance, the number we're testing gets larger than the number
00126     // of bits requested, we have to start over with a new random number of the
00127     // proper size.
00128     BOOST_XINT_RAWINT pe;
00129     pow2(pe, size_in_bits + 1);
00130 
00131     const BOOST_XINT_RAWINT two(2);
00132     while (1) {
00133         BOOST_XINT_RAWINT target = random_by_size(gen, size_in_bits, true, true,
00134             false);
00135         while (target < pe) {
00136             int r = is_probably_prime(target, gen, callback);
00137             if (r < 0) return 0;
00138             if (r == 1) return target;
00139             target += two;
00140         }
00141     }
00142 }
